column4: Do most of you just use the default network connection icon in the upper right hand corner when trying to connect to wireless networks or is there a better one?
i use the icon
what problem you having?
no problem really...just wondered if there was a better tool...this doesn't tell me any detailed info on the actual networks
or..maybe it does and i don't know how to view it
especially on the wifi connections that have the two pc icon in front of them...i can't seem to connect to any of those whereas I can if i'm in windows
those are other people's computers set to master mode
i know the card is working well though because i can connect to my wpa security enabled wifi with 0 issues
k that's what i thought ozzloy..
and when it's blank before the signal strength those are unsecured?
usually you don't want to connect to the internet through them
yes, blank means no wpa
thanks...now i just need to find an open one to fool around on :)
if you want more detailed info, look into iwlist
you can at the command line type iwconfig
that will give you the name of your wireless card
likely eth1 or eth0 or something similar
then type: iwlist eth1 scan
and it will print out a list of access points visible to eth1 (if that's your wireless card)
thanks again
np!  glad to help
